prTitle: feat: GitHub Actions build matrix for cross-platform agent binaries + stable host_id fix
prBody:
## Summary

This PR implements the GitHub Actions build matrix for cross-compiled TripWire agent release artifacts and addresses all blocking/significant review feedback from PR #236.

### GitHub Actions Build Matrix (`.github/workflows/build.yml`)

Already present on main; confirmed correct and complete:
- Matrix of 4 targets: `linux/amd64`, `linux/arm64`, `darwin/amd64`, `darwin/arm64`
- `CGO_ENABLED=0` static binaries, verified via `file` command on Linux targets
- Triggered on `push` to `main` (artifacts retained 7 days) and `v*.*.*` tags (GitHub Release)
- Release job downloads all 4 artifacts and publishes via `softprops/action-gh-release@v2`
- Version string injected at link time via `-X main.Version=<ver>`

### Review Feedback Addressed

#### BLOCKING — WebSocket oversized frame crash
Already fixed: `internal/server/websocket/handler.go` has the `rawLen > maxFrameSize` guard against int64 overflow before `make([]byte, length)`.

#### BLOCKING — `RegisterAgent` does not return a stable `host_id`
**Fixed in this PR:**
- Updated `grpc.Store` interface: `UpsertHost` now returns `(string, error)` matching the `postgres.Store` implementation
- `RegisterAgent` now generates a fresh `uuid.NewString()` candidate on each call; the DB `ON CONFLICT (hostname) DO UPDATE … RETURNING host_id` clause returns the pre-existing UUID on reconnect
- Removed `hostIDFromHostname` placeholder that returned the hostname string as the host_id
- Updated `mockStore` in tests to match new interface signature
- Added `TestRegisterAgent_StableHostID` and `TestRegisterAgent_HostIDIsUUID` tests

#### Additional — Test compilation failure in `process_watcher_test.go`
Already fixed: `process_watcher_test.go` (package `watcher`) defines its own `noopLogger()` function, independent of `file_test.go` (package `watcher_test`).

Closes #231
